channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Street furniture bollards, corner of Denmark and St. Giles High Streets, 31st October
item.description:
The knee height bollards here are a serious safety concern. For a partially sighted (or less) person this is a genuine hazard. I fell over one of these on Monday evening (27/10) and have seriously bruised and painful ribs and damage to the shopping I had recently collected. It was dark at 17:45 when the incident happened, and for the record I was not buried in my 'phone, rather looking ahead to see where I was going. Clearly they are not intended to prevent motor vehicle access.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15, St Giles Square, Bloomsbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Limebike blocking access to disabled person, 31st October
item.description:
Always parked in the middle of the pavement and always in front of a disabled bay as well as peoples front door. Blocking access. Very inconsiderate. This is a recurring issue, and my father is disabled, making it extremely inconvenient. No one in a wheelchair can get past, nor can people with prams. Very careless behavior from the individual, and it's recurring.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 83, Corbyn Street, Finsbury Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beverley Road, Barnehurst, London

item.title: Street/Public land. Health and Safety, 31st October
item.description:
Cleaners are not addressing this area and it has become a Health and Safety spot. Needs urgent attention. Over a year long problem. Hackney has not replied to any of the reports issued for the same spot.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Homerton High Street, Hackney, London

item.title: Mess left after term contractors work, 31st October
item.description:
Riney have just installed a new crossing point on South Eden Park Road at this location. They have left leaving concrete and other potential drain blocking rubbish in the gutters at the junction. It is unsightly, dangerous and if it gets in the junctions drains will cause blockages. These drains regularly overflow with heavy rainfall already. In addition, they have removed the supporting base from the bus stop and have left the two pieces just dumped on the verge. They need to be replaced on the bus stop. I have picked up all the drink cans, coffee cups and other food containers that they dumped around the job!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oakfield Gardens, Eden Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet
